experiment_design_description: Comparative metagenomic survey of gut microbiomes from 33 mammalian species, and 18 calorie-restricted humans, addressing the role of diet in shaping microbial communitry structure and function.
experiment_title: Diet drives convergence in gut microbiome functions across mammalian phylogeny and within humans
sample-isolation-and-treatment_sample_is:
Fecal samples were collected from wild and captive animals in the early morning and immediately frozen in N2 or dry ice, shipped or returned to the laboratory on dry ice, and preserved at -80ÃÂÃÂºC.  For conspecific animals housed in groups, 2-3 samples were obtained from separate parts of their shared nighttime living quarters, to ensure that they were produced by different individuals. 
Samples from wild animals were collected in Namibia (HartmannÃÂÃÂs Mountain 
Zebra, Hamadryas Baboon, Springbok, African Elephant) by observing animals drawn to 
a water hole.

Fecal samples were pulverized with a mortar and pestle at -80oC. A 500
mg aliquot of each frozen pulverized sample was re-suspended in a solution containing
500μL of extraction buffer [200mM Tris (pH 8.0), 200mM NaCl, 20mM EDTA], 210μL
of 20% SDS, 500μL of phenol:chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1) and 500μL of a
slurry of 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads. Cells were then mechanically disrupted
using a bead beater (Biospec, maximum setting; 3 min at room temperature), followed by
extraction with phenol:chloroform:isoamyl alcohol and precipitation with isopropanol.
sequences_sequences_combined_libraries: Amplicons generated from each set of three reactions were subsequently pooled and purified using Ampure magnetic purification beads (Agencourt). The amount of DNA was quantified using Picogreen (Invitrogen), and equimolar amounts of barcoded samples were pooled for each subsequent multiplex 454 FLX pyrosequencer run.
sequences_sequences_filtered: chimeric OTUs were removed using the ChimeraSlayer program (22).
sequences_sequences_predicted_genes: All BLAST hits within 10% of the best score (up to 100 hits) were used to generate a taxonomic assignment at each taxonomic level. If greater than 50% of the hits shared a designation, this annotation 4 was assigned to the OTU. Otherwise, the OTU was noted as nonidentified at that level. Note that sequences were binned into OTUs with ≥97% sequence identity in lane-masked regions.
title: mammalian gut microbiome
